text: HubSpot stores a _lot_ of data for each object, and so by default it doesn’t return all of it. Instead, you need to name all the fields you want in the `properties` query parameter.

Use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|Properties endpoints> to list all the available properties (this will include whatever custom properties you might have on your objects).
Thanks i'll try it out
It might help to provide more details of exactly what is going wrong: how far does the process go? Are you getting any errors?

Hey guys!

Is there any way to get the Files that are attached to a specific deal through the API?
<@U01DQEZ7BCZ> You can use this API query `<https://app.HubSpot.com/api/hubdb/api/v2/tables/5425998/rows/draft/search?portalId=21896839&searchTerm=tes&limit=1000>`
Credit goes to <@U01QVR44MEY> :raised_hands:
Hi guys, I’m fetching from the properties endpoint the currency. The options are coming as an empty array. Any ideas? Is not for any specific deal, just the property
Thanks for the credit <@U022YD6LGAU>:smile:
Thank you both! I was able to call the API directly instead of using the SDK. This works fine and I was able to complete this
<@U04L9MBL308> From your code above, looks like you are using the same HubSpot account, and not the external APIs. I will look into this
Next time, it will be earlier if you post on <#C04A3FUK8HK|crm-development-beta> since this is related to the beta.
Files aren't attached to a deal actually it's tied to an engagement (email, notes, calls etc) so it's a little difficult to get the files
You would need to get all the engagements and filter through those for files and then get those files

There isn't a default property for currency in HubSpot (at least not for the deal) the currency is apart of the entire portal information: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>
Is it possible to use legacy formsv3 API to submit data to a form with private app? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication>
yes you can
Does the private app replace the apikey?
yep
<https://api.hsforms.com/submissions/v3/integration/secure/submit/62515/fcc69886-915b-4fef-b35f-27850ef461e1?hapikey=demo>
but you need to use it in the headers not the url
so delete hapikey=demo
and in the request headers have Authorization: Bearer XXXX
Yep
just like that
ok thanks
i will try this out

<@U04L9MBL308> how about this, instead of search, can you replace any other API and try to see if your code executes successfully?

You can try console.log and view logs in the Private app’s logs tab for cards too.  Also, not sure if you are aware, you can get your private app access token via context
`PRIVATE_APP_ACCESS_TOKEN`

Does anyone have a valid response format to respond to a button press in the HubSpot App Settings page?
The Settings page docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/create-an-app-settings-page>
Shows an example response:
```{
  "response": null, # Ignored for beta
  "message": "Custom message to user" # Optional
}```
But every variation we try results in an “Action Failed” message.
Do you have a format that works as an app-settings page button press response? <@U01QVR44MEY>?
So you just want the data that is sent to the webhook when someone clicks a button in the settings page?
Hii, any have idea about like how we can send email to contact using HubSpot apis??
You can use the single send api for this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails>
You can also create a workflow that triggers based on a property change and then sends an email, and to trigger this workflow just update the property using the api
